thread.title: How David Cameron's political star plummeted into the sewage last week

author: Mike Kelly
title: How David Cameron's political star plummeted into the sewage last week
text:
News Opinion How David Cameron's political star plummeted into the sewage last week The former Tory party leader has struggled to put a foot right since he quit after the Brexit vote Share Former Prime Minister David Cameron and his wife Samantha (Image: PA) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It’s hard to feel sorry for David Cameron. 
Actually it’s impossible so I won’t even pretend to but the Gods have conspired against him of late to ensure that any thought of a political comeback in the wake of the Tory party melt down is just not going to happen. 
First of all the other week there was the interview with his wife Samantha in a society mag whose highlights included talk about her ‘slightly falling down’ £1.5m country cottage and the sight in one room of a sign on the wall which read: “Calm down dear it’s only a recession”. 
Unsurprisingly, not many people got the joke. 
They did however get the joke when Cameron was photographed at the appropriately named ‘Wilderness’ music festival. 
It wasn’t the fact he had a drink in one hand and a tab in the other (who knew he smoked?). 
It was because also in shot at the Oxfordshire event was one Lucy Edwards, wearing a glittery jacket with a neon pink heart on the back emblazoned with the word ‘Corbyn’. 
At the moment the snap was taken Cameron looked mildly discomfited. When he found out about the ‘C’ word (in Tory speak) on her back, he apparently found it very hard indeed to ‘Calm down’. 
Ms Edwards posted the photograph on Instagram and reportedly said: “Couldn’t have even planned it. 
“Big Dave C in the house, shame he can’t read.” 
She later wrote: “He was so mad when he saw me walk off with what was on my back.” 
It was not so long ago - May, 2015 to be precise - he was seen as the golden boy of politics who was to head a Tory revolution for the next decade. 
At the general election of that month he led the Tories to an unexpected majority. The North groaned in dismay at the thought of everlasting austerity. Read More What did David Cameron ever do for the North East? Here are 10* things 
However the means which helped him achieve the victory - the promise of an EU referendum - sowed the seeds of what was to come. 
As a result, the man with the Midas touch politically has seen his mythical talents reversed. Which brings me neatly to the latest episode. 
To cap a fine couple of weeks for the former Tory leader came the richly symbolic event at the end of this week. 
He was spotted enjoying a dip in the Cornish sea on his holiday. Nothing wrong with that. 
However on the day he braved the waves, lifeguards put out a red flag warning, telling holidaymakers not to go in the water because there was a spillage of raw, untreated sewage. 
So, he might have been literally swimming in...well, you get the picture. And not a very pretty one at that. Like us on Facebook
